ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I am much more confident in speaking French! The way the class is structured gave me plenty of opportunities to assert myself, and over time I starting taking those more and more.
I really loved the exploration of French culture through reading literature that I had never heard of before.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Prof. Schneider, the testing/essay structure (I appreciated the ability to make a draft for the writing assignments, and the way the in-class writings were weighted)

Weakness: I would have wished to review the trilogy by Krzysztof Kieslowski more in depth. I also felt as though some other movies (e.g. Welcome) were not discussed as thoroughly as I thought necessary.
I really loved all of the literature that we explored, especially Cond's autobiography.
Great course. The books we studied were very interesting and enjoyable to read. Teacher was also great.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This is the perfect course to conclude your learning of intermediate French and dip your toes into advanced/L5 French with. Should you not like it, there is no need to continue. I strongly recommend this course for anyone still interested in French after L4, or those that place into it.
I definitely would. I really enjoyed all of it even though the workload was slightly bigger than my other subjects.

Yes. I really enjoyed the texts we read. There is a large focus on memorization of grammar rules and vocabulary on exams, but beyond the studying required to know those, the course is pretty manageable. Mme. Schneider has high expectations, but is kind. Be ready to participate.
If your'e trying to get the french certificate, you have to take this course so yeah
